body:
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
osd-prepare job fails with the following error:
```
cephosd: saving osd dir map failed to save osd dir map. configmaps "rook-ceph-osd-<myhost1>-config" is forbidden: cannot set blockOwnerDeletion if an ownerReference refers to a resource you can't set finalizers on: no RBAC policy matched, <nil>
```
This is caused by rook-ceph-osd service account missing the following RBAC:
```
apiGroups: ["ceph.rook.io"]
resources: ["*"]
verbs: ["*"]
```
**Expected behavior:**
osd-prepare job completes successfully

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
Define a CephCluster using Rook v1.0.4 on OCP 3.11.98.

**File(s) to submit**:
I fixed this bug by adding the following lines here: https://github.com/rook/rook/blob/9ce0f293fcfd6ba01fc032cf325c9fa067067b41/cluster/examples/kubernetes/ceph/common.yaml#L480
```
- apiGroups: ["ceph.rook.io"]
  resources: ["*"]
  verbs: ["*"]
```
* Cluster CR (custom ressource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary
prepare-osd log final error entry:
```
cephosd: saving osd dir map failed to save osd dir map. configmaps "rook-ceph-osd-<myhost1>-config" is forbidden: cannot set blockOwnerDeletion if an ownerReference refers to a resource you can't set finalizers on: no RBAC policy matched, <nil>
```

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): RHEL 7.6
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): 1.0.4
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`):
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.11+
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): OpenShift 3.11.98
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)):
title: [ceph] Prepare OSD job cannot create rook-ceph-osd-config ConfigMap due to missing RBAC
